question_text: What happens if a device is configured with the wrong default gateway?
answer_options: The device will still connect to local devices, but not the internet
The device will use ARP to reroute traffic automatically
The device will receive an APIPA address instead
The device will reboot into Safe Mode
correct_answer: The device will still connect to local devices, but not the internet
explanation: If the default gateway is incorrect, local communication may still work, but external traffic will fail to reach the internet.
